item.title: 谷歌为何面临法庭对其广告技术的清算
item.description: 本月早些时候，美国法官拒绝强迫谷歌出售其 Chrome 浏览器，而是提出了较宽松的条件，以纠正该公司对搜索市场的非法垄断，从而避免了被解散的命运。但这家科技巨头并未摆脱危险。9 月 22 日，另一家联邦法院将举行听证会，权衡是否应强制谷歌出售其用于维持广告技术垄断地位的工具。此次听证会是继今年 4 月法院做出以下裁决之后的又一次听证会【原文：Google avoided being broken up earlier this month when a US judge declined to force the company to sell its Chrome browser and instead imposed lighter conditions to remedy the company’s illegal monopoly of the search market. But the tech giant isn’t out of jeopardy. On Sept. 22, a different federal court will hold a hearing to weigh whether Google should be compelled to sell tools it has used to maintain a monopoly over advertising technology. The hearing follows a ruling by the court in April t】

item.title: 欧盟在打击俄罗斯能源进口方面迈出最大一步
item.description: 欧盟能源部长表示，欧盟拟在明年年底前禁止使用俄罗斯液化天然气的制裁措施是一个最新迹象，表明欧盟正在不遗余力地加快摆脱对莫斯科的能源依赖。【原文：The European Union’s proposed sanctions banning Russian liquefied natural gas by the end of next year are the latest sign that it is leaving no stone unturned in accelerating its exit from energy reliance on Moscow, according to the bloc’s energy chief.】

item.title: 风险投资人、前罗杰斯首席执行官纳迪尔-穆罕默德（Nadir Mohamed）逝世，享年 69 岁
item.description: 跟随创始人特德-罗杰斯（Ted Rogers）担任罗杰斯通信公司首席执行官的纳迪尔-穆罕默德（Nadir Mohamed）去世。享年 69 岁。【原文：Nadir Mohamed, the man who followed founder Ted Rogers as Chief Executive Officer of Rogers Communications Inc., has died. He was 69.】

item.title: 风险生物技术股的复苏取决于美联储更大幅度的降息
item.description: 美联储进一步降息的前景，终于让生物技术行业的忠实信徒们在经历了四年的煎熬之后，有理由保持谨慎的乐观。【原文：The prospect of further interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve is finally giving diehard believers in the biotechnology sector reason for guarded optimism after a punishing four years.】

item.title: 太阳能制造商因金属价格飙升而放弃使用白银
item.description: 全球太阳能制造商是白银的最大工业消费者，在白银价格飙升的背景下，他们将在数年内首次减少贵金属的使用量。【原文：Global solar manufacturers, the largest industrial consumers of silver, are set to reduce use of the precious metal for the first time in years amid a scorching rally in its price.】

item.title: 派拉蒙新老板面临媒体行业的冲击
item.description:
大卫-埃里森获得了他想要的合并—但在深夜喜剧演员因总统不喜欢的独白而被撤职的政治环境下，他的公司转型既不便宜也不容易。【原文：

David Ellison got the merger he wanted—but transforming his company won’t be cheap or easy in a political environment where late-night comics are being pulled for monologues the president dislikes.

】

item.title: 德怀特为多户住宅建设基金筹资 10 亿美元
item.description: 德怀特证券管理有限责任公司（Dwight Securities Management LLC）筹集资金，准备发放多达 10 亿美元的建筑贷款，目标是解决导致全美住房成本上升的住房短缺问题。【原文：Dwight Securities Management LLC raised funding to originate as much as $1 billion in construction loans, targeting the housing shortage that has driven up costs across the US.】

item.title: 鲍威尔对利率前景发表看法，国债全周下滑
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔抑制了更积极降息的希望后，国债有望出现 8 月中旬以来的首次单周下跌。【原文：Treasuries were poised for their first weekly decline since mid-August after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell dampened hopes for more aggressive interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 里夫斯希望堵住财政黑洞，为何英国增税迫在眉睫？
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）即将迎来一个艰难的秋季预算，经济学家们做出了一个共同的预测：增税在即。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is heading into a difficult autumn budget as economists make a common prediction: tax rises are in store.】

item.title: Meta 向美国监管机构申请开始销售电力批发业务
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司已向美国联邦监管机构提交了在批发市场销售电力的申请。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. has filed an application with US federal regulators to sell electricity in wholesale markets.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德支持的 Rockpoint Gas Storage 申请在多伦多上市
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）的北美天然气存储平台 Rockpoint Gas Storage 已在加拿大申请首次公开募股。【原文：Rockpoint Gas Storage, Brookfield Asset Management’s North American natural gas storage platform, has filed for an initial public offering in Canada.】

item.title: 丽莎-库克案哈佛出身的法官面临最高法院考验
item.description: 作为一个在底特律长大的小女孩，贾-科布经常在父亲的律师事务所度过时光，就像她父亲和他的父亲一样。【原文：As a little girl growing up in Detroit, Jia Cobb often spent time at her father’s law office—just as her father did with his father, who in 1930, was one of the first Black graduates from the University of Chicago Law School.】

item.title: 特朗普停摆后，美国在外国保险公司中重获青睐
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统第二任政府执政的头几个月里，外国保险公司减少了购买美国资产的步伐，而在此之后，外国保险公司又开始大量购买美国资产。【原文：Foreign insurers are piling up US assets again after reducing the pace of buys during the first few months of President Donald Trump’s second administration.】

item.title: 再融资谈判失败，印度港口公司开始采取法律行动
item.description: 在再融资谈判破裂后，Mercantile Ports & Logistics Ltd. 表示已开始对银行集团采取法律行动。【原文：Mercantile Ports & Logistics Ltd. said it started legal action against a group of banks after a breakdown in refinancing talks.】

item.title: 美国股指连创四项纪录后股市走高
item.description: 周五，美国股市延续了本周的涨势，在美联储降息后，美国四大股指自2021年以来首次创下历史新高。【原文：US equities extended this week’s advance on Friday, building on an everything rally that saw four major US stock benchmarks post records in unison for the first time since 2021 after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates.】

item.title: 中国对酷狗直播电子商务展开调查
item.description: 中国市场监管部门正开始调查酷开科技旗下一家公司如何利用直播服务促进电子商务，这对一直在向在线销售领域扩张的流行视频服务来说是一个潜在的挫折。【原文：China’s market regulator is beginning a probe into a unit of Kuaishou Technology for how live-streaming services are used to promote e-commerce, a potential setback for the popular video service that has been expanding into online sales.】

item.title: 欧盟对俄罗斯的打压将打击第三国炼油商和贸易商
item.description: 欧盟对俄罗斯的下一轮制裁将针对全球石油行业的大部分企业，因为欧盟希望加大对克里姆林宫获取石油美元的压力。【原文：The European Union’s next round of sanctions against Russia will target large parts of the global oil industry as the bloc looks to intensify pressure on the Kremlin’s access to petrodollars.】

item.title: 阿特金斯表示，美国证券交易委员会将全面修订投资者信息披露规则
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）主席保罗-阿特金斯（Paul Atkins）周五表示，该委员会将继续推进全面修订上市公司投资者信息披露规则的计划。【原文：The Securities and Exchange Commission will move forward with plans to overhaul investor disclosure rules for publicly-traded companies, agency Chairman Paul Atkins said Friday.】

item.title: Altice International 债权人与华利安进行债务谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁帕特里克-德雷希（Patrick Drahi）苦苦挣扎的电信帝国的一部分--阿尔迪斯国际公司（Altice International）的债权人已选择华利安公司（Houlihan Lokey）作为与该公司进行债务谈判的财务顾问。【原文：Creditors to Altice International, part of billionaire Patrick Drahi’s struggling telecommunications empire, have picked Houlihan Lokey as financial adviser for debt talks with the company, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Ecopetrol 寻求巴西陆上交易，关注巴西国家石油公司集群
item.description: 哥伦比亚石油生产商 Ecopetrol SA 正在巴西寻求石油和天然气交易，其中可能包括巴西国家石油公司在巴伊亚州东北部的陆上油田群。【原文：Colombian oil producer Ecopetrol SA is pursuing oil and gas deals in Brazil that could include a cluster of onshore Petrobras fields in the northeastern state of Bahia.】

item.title: 国防公司 CSG 据称将增加银行参与 30 亿欧元的首次公开募股工作
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，国防制造商捷克斯洛伐克集团公司（Czechoslovak Group AS）已增加了更多的银行参与其潜在的首次公开募股工作，可能会募集到 30 亿欧元（35 亿美元）或更多资金。【原文：Defense manufacturer Czechoslovak Group AS has added more banks to work on its potential initial public offering that could raise €3 billion ($3.5 billion) or more, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 工厂受到冲击，俄罗斯燃料运输量下滑，国内需求成为优先事项
item.description: 在乌克兰无人机对炼油厂的袭击不断升级导致产量减少、生产商优先考虑国内市场之后，俄罗斯石油产品出口降至战时最低水平。【原文：Russian oil product exports dropped to a wartime low after escalating Ukrainian drone strikes on refineries reduced output and producers prioritized the home market.】

item.title: 阿布扎比和迪拜为数十亿美元的 EGA 上市向银行求助
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿联酋全球铝业公司（Emirates Global Aluminium PJSC）已选定银行安排可能的首次公开募股，这可能是中东地区最大的上市活动之一。【原文：Emirates Global Aluminium PJSC has picked banks to arrange a potential initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, in what could be one of the largest listings in the Middle East.】

item.title: 与日本 SMBC 达成协议后，印度 Yes 银行开始进军财富管理领域
item.description: 在与日本三井住友银行（Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp.【原文：Indian private lender Yes Bank Ltd. is exploring entering the country’s booming wealth management space following its strategic partnership with Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp.】

item.title: 这会伤害我们"：特朗普下令停止海上风电项目，1.5 万个工作岗位岌岌可危
item.description: 塞萨尔-利马（Cesar Lima）从未考虑过海上风电的政治问题。大多数时候，这位铁工专注于在 15 英里外的海面上工作，攀爬涡轮机，观看海豚从罗德岛海岸附近的船上滑过。【原文：Cesar Lima never gave much thought to the politics of offshore wind. Most days, the ironworker focused on his shift 15 miles out at sea, climbing turbines and watching dolphins gliding past his vessel off the coast of Rhode Island.】

item.title: 零售业反弹，加拿大消费者在贸易战中保持韧性
item.description: 加拿大零售业上个月取得了相对健康的增长，弥补了自 2022 年以来第三季度最糟糕的开局。【原文：Canadian retail sales made up for the worst start to a third quarter since 2022 with a relatively healthy gain last month.】

item.title: 住房需求下降，木材关税未能阻止价格下滑
item.description: 今年早些时候，特朗普政府将加拿大软木木材的进口费用提高了一倍多，其目的是支持国内价格，促进美国生产。但结果却是价格暴跌，边境两侧的木材厂都在缩减规模。【原文：When the Trump administration more than doubled import fees on Canadian softwood lumber earlier this year, the goal was to support domestic prices and boost US production. Instead, prices have plunged, and mills on both sides of the border are scaling back.】

item.title: 阿波罗与施罗德商谈私募市场合作事宜
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is in early talks with Schroders Plc to form a potential product partnership that could see the private capital giant source assets for the UK’s largest standalone money manager.】

item.title: 抵押债券在现金充裕的房地产投资信托基金中找到了现成的买家
item.description: 抵押房地产投资信托基金正在抢购由美国住房贷款支持的债券，抢购速度之快是大流行病爆发前所未见的，它们利用相对便宜的估值和自身股票的反弹帮助筹集了新的现金。【原文：Mortgage REITs are snapping up bonds backed by US home loans at a pace last seen before the pandemic, taking advantage of relatively cheap valuations and rallies in their own shares that helped them raise fresh cash.】

item.title: 布拉德称本周不会支持 50 个基点
item.description: 前圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长詹姆斯-布拉德（James Bullard）是美国央行下一任主席的候选人之一，他表示，他不会支持本周降息50个基点。【原文：Former Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard, who is in the running to be the next chair of the US central bank, said that he wouldn’t have backed a 50 basis point interest-rate cut this week.】
